meanings.definition: To betray or inform on someone to the authorities.
meanings.sent1: Tom ratted on his friend to the teacher.
meanings.sent2: She ratted out her brother for breaking the vase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ratted on the sneaky raccoon to the forest ranger.
meanings.sent4: The spy ratted out his own team, revealing their secret plans.
meanings.sent5: The colorful parrot ratted on the cat, alerting the family of its presence.

meanings.definition: To squeal or tattle on someone.
meanings.sent1: The little girl ratted to her mom about her brother eating cookies before dinner.
meanings.sent2: He ratted to the principal about the bullies in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent3: The clever mouse ratted to the farmer about the sneaky cat's plan to catch the chickens.
meanings.sent4: The loyal dog ratted on the burglars, barking loudly to alert the neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The brave knight ratted on the dragon, warning the villagers of its approach.

meanings.definition: To become a traitor or informant.
meanings.sent1: The double agent ratted on both sides, causing chaos in the spy world.
meanings.sent2: She ratted on her own gang, leading to their arrest.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox ratted on the other animals, hoping to gain favor with the hunter.
meanings.sent4: The turncoat ratted on his former allies, revealing their weaknesses to the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The undercover cop ratted on the criminal organization, bringing them to justice.
